meanings.definition: The quality or state of being insurable.
meanings.sent1: The insurabilities of the new car made it easy to get insurance.
meanings.sent2: Insurance companies assess the insurabilities of different properties before providing coverage.
meanings.sent3: The insurabilities of the clumsy puppy made it a risky choice for pet insurance.
meanings.sent4: Her insurabilities were like a shield, protecting her from unexpected financial losses.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the insurabilities of your assets can help you make informed insurance decisions.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be insured.
meanings.sent1: The insurabilities of the rare artwork made it a valuable asset to insure.
meanings.sent2: When considering the insurabilities of a business, it's important to evaluate all potential risks.
meanings.sent3: The insurabilities of the antique vase were so high that even the insurance agent was surprised.
meanings.sent4: His insurabilities were like a safety net, ensuring he was always protected financially.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the insurabilities of your possessions can help you determine the right insurance coverage.
